author: cnbc.com
title: Pacific Premier Bancorp: 1Q Earnings Snapshot
text:
IRVINE, Calif. (AP) _ Pacific Premier Bancorp Inc. (PPBI) on Tuesday reported first-quarter earnings of $28 million.
The Irvine, California-based company said it had profit of 60 cents per share. Earnings, adjusted for costs related to mergers and acquisitions, came to 62 cents per share.
The results did not meet Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of four analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of 63 cents per share.
The holding company for Pacific Premier Bank posted revenue of $98.5 million in the period. Its adjusted revenue was $88.9 million, also missing Street forecasts. Three analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $89.1 million.
Pacific Premier Bancorp shares have decreased roughly 1 percent since the beginning of the year. The stock has climbed almost 9 percent in the last 12 months.
This story was generated by Automated Insights ( http://automatedinsights.com/ap ) using data from Zacks Investment Research. Access a Zacks stock report on PPBI at https://www.zacks.com/ap/PPBI
